Package cetus.analysis

Class IPPointsToAnalysis

  • java.lang.Object
    • cetus.analysis.AnalysisPass
      • cetus.analysis.IPAnalysis
        • cetus.analysis.IPPointsToAnalysis
  • public class IPPointsToAnalysis
extends IPAnalysis
    Interprocedural analysis enables computation of points-to relations through whole-program analysis provided by the common interprocedural framework in Cetus. The algorithms are based on "Context-sensitive inter-procedural points-to analysis in the presence of function pointers", PLDI'94. Although handling of function pointers and precise context-sensitivity as in the paper are not supported, the analysis provides single-depth context-sensitivity (differentiates call sites) and supports most features presented in the paper.

    • Method Detail

      • getPointsToRelations

        public static Domain getPointsToRelations​(Statement stmt)
        Returns points-to relations for the given statement. The program is analyzed again if the result is invalid.
        Parameters:
        stmt - the statement before which points-to relations are computed.
        Returns:
        the points-to relations map for the procedure.

      • clearPointsToRelations

        public static void clearPointsToRelations()
        Invalidates the analysis result. A transformation pass should trigger this operation.

      • updatePointsToRelations

        public static void updatePointsToRelations​(Program program)
        Recompute the static points-to relations for the given program. The result of the analysis is stored as a static map for future reuse.
        Parameters:
        program - the program to be analyzed.

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts interprocedural points-to analysis.
        Overrides:
        start in class IPAnalysis

      • analyzeProcedure

        public void analyzeProcedure​(IPANode node)
        Invokes intraprocedural analysis. The following information is the input to the intra analysis. - IN data after mapping process. - OUT data after each call site.
        Specified by:
        analyzeProcedure in class IPAnalysis
        Parameters:
        node - the procedure node to be analyzed.

      • getReturnRelations

        public static java.util.Set<PointsToRel> getReturnRelations​(CallSite callsite)
        Returns the set of points-to relations pointed by the return value of the specified function call. It uses the normalized return value as the pointer symbol and the caller's symbol as the pointed-to symbol. For a standard library call, the function symbol is used as the pointer symbol.
        Parameters:
        callsite - the calling site that generates the query.
        Returns:
        the set of return points-to relations. an empty set means there is no relations created, and null means no information is available (should produce universe doamin).

      • isSafeLibraryCall

        public static boolean isSafeLibraryCall​(FunctionCall fcall)
        Checks if the given function call is known for having no side effects on the "points-to relation" (not on memory).
        Parameters:
        fcall - the function call to be examined.
        Returns:
        true if it is either a standard library call or a known system library call.

      • updateCalls

        public java.util.Set<CallSite> updateCalls​(IPANode node)
        Updates the forward information for each call site by performing mapping, and by maintaining map-info for each different single-depth context.
        Specified by:
        updateCalls in class IPAnalysis
        Parameters:
        node - the procedure node being analyzed.
        Returns:
        the set of call sites whose data has been changed.

      • updateCall

        public boolean updateCall​(IPANode node)
        Not used.
        Specified by:
        updateCall in class IPAnalysis
        Parameters:
        node - the node that was just analyzed.
        Returns:
        true if the IN data of any call site has been updated.

      • updateReturn

        public boolean updateReturn​(IPANode node)
        Updates the backward information available at the exit of a procedure by performing unmapping.
        Specified by:
        updateReturn in class IPAnalysis
        Parameters:
        node - the procedure node to be analyzed.
        Returns:
        true if there is any state change, false otherwise.
